{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 26-year-old healthy female who recently gave birth and had a cesarean section due to fetal distress. She developed headache and seizures two days after delivery. Mild hypertension was present during pregnancy. The CT scan shows a 2 x 3 cm parasagittal hematoma. Proteinuria is not mentioned, which is an important finding in eclampsia. Given the history of hypertension, the most likely diagnosis is hypertensive intracranial hemorrhage. Sagittal sinus thrombosis and pituitary apoplexy are less likely in this scenario.", "answer_choice": "B. Hypertensive intracranial hemorrhage"}
